“Best practices” donot actually work

Ihave written a few thousand words on why traditional “semantic class names” are the reason CSS is hard to maintain, but the truth is youre never going to believe me until you actually try it. If you can suppress the urge to retch long enough to give it a chance, I really think youll wonder how you ever worked with CSS any other way.

Adam Sandler

The way I wrote it changed frequently. Its not a coincidence Tailwind was released the same year. It might look wrong, but spend time with it and youll realize semantic CSS was a 20 year mistake.
